summary: Went to Disneyland recently and saw them renovating California Adventure to add more Marvel rides and decor. While I always love...
caption: Went to Disneyland recently and saw them renovating California Adventure to add more Marvel rides and decor. While I always love seeing Walt Disney statue in Disneyland, I would love just as much as seeing a Stan Lee statute on the California Adventure side. Come on Disney. Excelsior! Make it happen

blog.name: imaginingyourfandom
blog.title: Imagining Your Fandom
blog.description: I create gif imagines, preferences, oneshots and prompts for most fandoms. REQUESTS: OPEN

summary: “You know you don’t have to help me. I have all the help I need, I will be able to do this. Don’t worry.” He reassured.  You...
caption:
“You know you don’t have to help me. I have all the help I need, I will be able to do this. Don’t worry.” He reassured.

You smiled softly, “I know but you’d do the same for me. You’re family. Family always has each others back. I’m here for you.”

“Thank you. Don’t know what I’d do without you.”

“I know.”

Requested By allisonbaelfire

“Thank you. Don’t know what I’d do without you.”

summary: Bucky x reader - Power Day fourteen: “Oh no, not them…” Everyone has that one person they never want to deal with. Who is that...
body:
Bucky x reader - Power

Day fourteen: “Oh no, not them…” Everyone has that one person they never want to deal with. Who is that person to your character and why? - @sdavid09 

Bucky spent most of the day trying to find either Loki or Bruce but none of them were anywhere to be found. As he thought about it, he hadn’t seen anyone all day.

“Guys?” He called as he walked the hall.

Bucky froze, wasn’t this how his dream started? He blew out a quick breath and waited. It didn’t turn to steam, so that was a good sign…. right?

“Jarvis?”

Nothing.

“Jarvis?” He tried again.

The AI didn’t respond and Bucky was starting to panic. That’s when he heard it. A yell come from the comman room, he didn’t even think about his options as he sprinted towards it, noticing how cold it was becoming. His heart pounded.

Skidding into the room, the avengers were sprawled on the floor, you were stood in the middle of them. On the other side of them was a face he thought he’d never had to see again. A cold panic washed over him.

“Ah, if it isn’t the winter soldier.”

“Oh no… not them… please anything but them…” he panicked.

Your gaze flicked from Bucky to the man. You knew who the winter soldier was, everyone did. You knew what he had done and what happened to him. Bucky stumbles back, trying to put on a brave face but he couldn’t do it.

“Time to come home soldier.”

“No!” You snapped.

His eyes flew to you in shock, you stood there, fists clenched, eyes set with a slight glow to them. He noticed how your (H/C) hair now had hints of white.

“Now, this doesn’t involved you.” The man snarled, aiming his gun at you.

A shot rang out and Bucky watched in horror as you fell to the ground, it all seemed to happen so slow. You falling, him screaming your name, him running, one of his former handlers saying the words. As Bucky cover his ears trying to block the voice out, he missed your eyes snapping open.

As Bucky tried to block out the laughter, trying not not hear the words. He heard the fourth one before another yell broke through the room. His head snapped up to see you now standing. Hair white, just like his dream.

“Leave him alone!” You snarled.

“Or what?” The man taunted.

You seemed to think about this before you begun stalking over to him. Under your foot ice covered the floor as hit slowly crept around the room. Bucky needed to calm down but as his eyes landed on the other he needed to get them out as well. With another glance at you, be staggered up, looping his arms under thro as he begun to drag the got to the elevator. Going back for Steve, Peitro and Clint.

He grabbed Tony and Bruce by their shirts and dragged them over. Pressing the down button he was thankful it still worked. The rooms temperature had dramatically dropped so he had to be quick. Bucky ran over, hauling Natasha and Wanda over his shoulders as he brought them to the other elevator and gently laid them down. Pulling Loki over he looked around, eyes landing on Pepper who was cuddled near a cabnit.

Running over he pulled his hoodie of and threw it over her shivering form.

“Are you okay?” He whispered.

“Y…yeah….”

Bucky glances over at you at the scientist before back at her. Picking her up bridal style, he took her to the others before sending that elevator down as well. Now, he turned back to you.

You had finally walked over, and you just stood there. Horror now washed over the mans face, realising what kind of trouble his was in. His eyes flicked over to Bucky, his mouth opening. Your hand to his chest and stopped, before you tapped him lightly, his whole body instantly covered in ice. And with another tap, he shattered.

“(Y/N)?” Bucky called.

You didn’t respond, he dared to walk a few steps closer.

“Doll?”

You turned to him, but not a glimmer of recognition was on your face. You stalked over to him, Bucky tried to walk back but his feet were stuck. I’ve slowly crawled up his legs as you got closer. Making its way up to his waist by the time you were in front of him.

Outside snow rained down on the city, thunder shook the building. You stared him in the eyes as you stood there, and for once, Bucky was terrified. He was terrified of what you could do, what were you capable of doing?

“(Y/N), you need to stop.” He whispered.

Your hand reached out, stopping at his chest. Bucky could hear his hear in his ears, leaning back as much as he could to avoid being touched. He tore his eyes from your gaze and focused on your neck. There was blood there, a large splatter of it frozen to your skin. It leaked onto your shirt staining the fabric. But there was no wound.

“(Y/N)?” He pleaded.

You stopped, millimetres in front of him. Turning your head the window, back to him and then back to the window. Dropping your arm, without a single word you begun to make your way to it and Bucky begun to panic. He couldn’t let you out.

“(Y/N) doll, listen, you don’t want to to this. You don’t have to do this.”

You didn’t look back, and he begun to panic even more.

With his metal arm he begun to punch the ice, but it had no effect. You stood before the window, placing your hand on the glass, ice creeped around it before it shattered outward. In the blink of en eye you were gone.

Bucky begun hitting the ice even more, finally cracking it a little, the only thought on his mind was he had to get out, he had to get to you before you hurt someone or yourself. Then it suddenly made sense, it wasn’t him they were really after, it was you

TAGS:

Marvel: @emiwrites3reads @captainmarvel16 @darth-dorle @stiffinme @startrekkingaroundasgard

All: @sitkafay @havlindzk @drakelover78

At first sight: @stiffinme @shootingstarsaretearsofheaven @colie87 @isabella212 @kiliakit @tynabyna @theharlequinwriter @leenat23 @theactualscarletwitch @nayr9e

Day fourteen: “Oh no, not them…” Everyone has that one person they never want to deal with. Who is that person to your character and why? - @sdavid09

Outside snow rained down on the city, thunder shook the building. You stared him in the eyes as you stood there, and for once, Bucky was terrified. He was terrified of what you could do, what were you capable of doing?

“(Y/N), you need to stop.” He whispered.

Your hand reached out, stopping at his chest. Bucky could hear his hear in his ears, leaning back as much as he could to avoid being touched. He tore his eyes from your gaze and focused on your neck. There was blood there, a large splatter of it frozen to your skin. It leaked onto your shirt staining the fabric. But there was no wound.

“(Y/N)?” He pleaded.

You stopped, millimetres in front of him. Turning your head the window, back to him and then back to the window. Dropping your arm, without a single word you begun to make your way to it and Bucky begun to panic. He couldn’t let you out.

“(Y/N) doll, listen, you don’t want to to this. You don’t have to do this.”

You didn’t look back, and he begun to panic even more.

With his metal arm he begun to punch the ice, but it had no effect. You stood before the window, placing your hand on the glass, ice creeped around it before it shattered outward. In the blink of en eye you were gone.

Bucky begun hitting the ice even more, finally cracking it a little, the only thought on his mind was he had to get out, he had to get to you before you hurt someone or yourself. Then it suddenly made sense, it wasn’t him they were really after, it was you

Bucky glances over at you at the scientist before back at her. Picking her up bridal style, he took her to the others before sending that elevator down as well. Now, he turned back to you.

You had finally walked over, and you just stood there. Horror now washed over the mans face, realising what kind of trouble his was in. His eyes flicked over to Bucky, his mouth opening. Your hand to his chest and stopped, before you tapped him lightly, his whole body instantly covered in ice. And with another tap, he shattered.

“(Y/N)?” Bucky called.

You didn’t respond, he dared to walk a few steps closer.

“Doll?”

You turned to him, but not a glimmer of recognition was on your face. You stalked over to him, Bucky tried to walk back but his feet were stuck. I’ve slowly crawled up his legs as you got closer. Making its way up to his waist by the time you were in front of him.

Outside snow rained down on the city, thunder shook the building. You stared him in the eyes as you stood there, and for once, Bucky was terrified. He was terrified of what you could do, what were you capable of doing?

“(Y/N), you need to stop.” He whispered.

Your hand reached out, stopping at his chest. Bucky could hear his hear in his ears, leaning back as much as he could to avoid being touched. He tore his eyes from your gaze and focused on your neck. There was blood there, a large splatter of it frozen to your skin. It leaked onto your shirt staining the fabric. But there was no wound.

“(Y/N)?” He pleaded.

You stopped, millimetres in front of him. Turning your head the window, back to him and then back to the window. Dropping your arm, without a single word you begun to make your way to it and Bucky begun to panic. He couldn’t let you out.

“(Y/N) doll, listen, you don’t want to to this. You don’t have to do this.”

You didn’t look back, and he begun to panic even more.

With his metal arm he begun to punch the ice, but it had no effect. You stood before the window, placing your hand on the glass, ice creeped around it before it shattered outward. In the blink of en eye you were gone.

Bucky begun hitting the ice even more, finally cracking it a little, the only thought on his mind was he had to get out, he had to get to you before you hurt someone or yourself. Then it suddenly made sense, it wasn’t him they were really after, it was you

summary: For those of you thinking Steve didn’t save Bucky because Bucky didn’t get old. This is how the time travel in the MCU...
body:
For those of you thinking Steve didn’t save Bucky because Bucky didn’t get old. This is how the time travel in the MCU works.

Its openly stated that going back in time and changing the past won’t change your present. Hence why murdering baby Thanos wouldn’t work.

Going back in time and killing baby Thanos wouldn’t effect the events of Infinity war, the same as killing 2014 Thanos didn’t resurrect Loki, Gamora, or Vision. So when Cap time traveled to return the stones and prevent branched realities. When he stayed he essentially created his own branched off reality where he could marry Peggy, Save Bucky from Hydra, prevent the deaths of the Stark parents, and none of it would effect the present timeline. Upon Peggy’s death (Most likely) in 2016 Cap Used the time travel to return to the main timeline with the shield from the alternate as a gift for Sam to take up the new mantle of Captain America.

Also a fun thing to point out, in the alternate timeline if Cap stopped Hydra from sending Bucky out on missions, JFK is likely still alive in that timeline, and Tony probably had an Uncle Steve, Aunt Peggy, and Uncle Bucky.

summary: Tony Stark, when demonstrating the Jericho missile in Iron Man, said, "They say that the best weapon is the one that you never...
body:
Tony Stark, when demonstrating the Jericho missile in Iron Man, said, “They say that the best weapon is the one that you never have to fire. I respectfully disagree. I prefer the weapon you only have to fire once.”

True to that philosophy, in Avengers: Endgame, he snapped the gauntlet once and got rid of Thanos and his army.

reblog.comment:
